name: Pompano Beach Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a such a great time during our stay this past week. The magic of the breathtaking hillside location was only exceeded by the caring and friendly Lamb family and Pompano Beach Club staff. All of our of our needs were met quickly and with good cheer. It is no wonder that the resort is featured on the cover of Fodors Bermuda 2009.
reviews.title: Pompano Beach Club is the essence of Bermuda

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was very good which is unusal for a resort with a meal plan. 5 course dinner every night.
reviews.title: The Best Place In Bermuda!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The western island location provided great sunsets and perfect swimming conditions. Some snokeling right off the beach.
reviews.title: Resort with Bed and Breakfast Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been fortunate enough to travel many places in the world, and for our most special celebrations we always choose Pompano Beach Club. We have stayed at Pompano three times in the past ten years, most recently July 10-16, 2009. Each time we have been impressed with many new services and amenities. Brothers Tom and Larry Lamb along with their friendly and genuine staff work non-stop to ensure that every guest has a memorable experience, and they make it so personable by actually remembering their guests’ names! The entire property is impeccably maintained, the food is delicious, and their private beach is pristine. Beach towels are fresh and fluffy each morning, and all areas on the multi-level property are spic and span, including the pool, several Jacuzzi’s, and all of the many secluded spots in the privacy you can get without a reservation. There is a full-service spa, and a water-view fitness center with up-to-date equipment. We took advantage of the complimentary shuttle service provided by Tom, Larry and the staff when we wanted to go to Port Royal Golf Course, a ferry dock with service to Hamilton, and a marina where we rented a boat and later hired a captain who took us for a ½ day exciting reef fishing trip. Pompano also has complimentary water sports and a reef in front of the property that provides excellent snorkeling. There is entertainment nightly, two dining rooms with menus that change daily, and pc’s in the lobby with free internet service. There are many different areas from which to choose to lounge and gaze at the spectacular aqua-colored water and magnificent sunsets. Pompano caters not only to couples, but they have created a family-friendly atmosphere complete with many activities indoors as well, including a pool table, ping pong table, computer games, and many other options.
reviews.title: Very special honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you add it all up, Pompano is the best. Despite just returning from Pompano, we are already planning a return trip.
reviews.title: Best place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Our last visit was fantastic!! We have been to the Pompano about 6 times. The first was our Honeymoon and this last time was our 30th Anniversary. At the Pompano it is all about the little things done very well. You are greated like old friends given a personal tour of the property as your bags are wisked to your room. My husband and I have been fortunate to travel to many many beaches in many countries and we feel the views from the Pompano are the best we have ever seen. The food is amazing! I highly recommend a stay here you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Repeaters!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Pompano for the first 4 days of our honeymoon and let me tell you, I wish we stayed there longer. It's a lovely hotel, with wonderful staff, great views, great food, and a really intimate feel. I honestly cannot find one bad thing to say about it. the food was excellent and we also took part in the dine-around program, which is really great. We only had the oppurtunity to eat at one other hotel, Cambridge Beaches, and the food there was phenomenal. The staff is really nice. The owner/manager gave us a personal tour of the hotel and it's grounds, as well as, personally escorted us to our room. My husband forgot his sunglasses and CC, the bellman, drove us to the gas station so he could buy sunglasses, waited for us, and then took us to get mopeds. Later in the week, the manager behind the front desk stopped what he was doing and took us to the ferry. They go out of your way to give you the best personalized service. The beach is small, but we didn't find it to be crowded and the pool area is nice as well. Make sure you try the nachos at the pool bar! Lastly, I would recommend that anyone who is able to rent a scooter should. It's the best way to see Bermuda and I think the most economical. Bermuda is a beautiful, magical place and Pompano epitomizes all the good things in Bermuda. We will be back!
reviews.title: A TRUELY Wonderful Hotel!!!
casual but deluxe
reviews.text: A tiny jewel in Bermuda. Spectacular beach and setting. Casual but deluxe. Wonderful chef and food. Great location for golfers right next door to Port Royal Golf Course with amazing view from the course. Very comfortable for families. We loved the friendly staff and feeling. Perfect vacation!!!!

reviews.title: Superb Vacation Retreat
reviews.text: My wife and I shared a fantastic Bermuda vacation at the Pompano Beach Club. If it were not for all the places to see on the island we could have remained on site and had a truly great time.

reviews.title: Perfect Pampano
reviews.text: The beach has a westward view so there is plenty of sun in the afternoon; but for solar phobes like me there are plenty of beach umbrellas. I enjoyed reading in the shade while my wife spent some of her time in the surf. The water is clear and a beautiful shade of green. The beach bar was well tended and the "Yellow Bird" rum punch was a perfect compliment to my reading.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Pomapano for 5 nights, and found it to be a very relaxing spot. If you are looking for a very lively scene, this might not be the hotel for you. We stayed in a deluxe room right over the beach, you could hear the waves lapping on the sand, and look right down into crystal clear water. It might be worth spending extra for a deluxe room, to save you many steep steps up to the other rooms.
reviews.title: A very nice small hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is not the glamorous type, it has much more of a lodge feeling, which I believe they started out as a fishing lodge way back when. This does not mean it is not lovely, because it is , but it not Elbow Beach which is one of the very big fancy lobby hotels. The hotel is very clean and the staff is exceptionally friendly, they would do just about anything they could to make your stay more comfortable. We were always meeting one of the owners around the hotel, they remembered you and would ask how the plans they helped you with worked out.
reviews.title: Loved the Pompano, would go back anytime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: The beach is small but we found room and might only be crowded for a short time. Their are some sharp rocks you need to walk thru to get to into the beautiful water, I highly recommend bringing water shoes, they are a huge help, many people had them. We went into Hamiliton and bought them, they were worth the price.
reviews.title: Very Happy at Pompano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food in the restaurants was very good, though the dining rooms are bit dreary and need a little fixing up. We were able to go Cambridge Beaches for dinner twice, the food was about the same as Pompano, but the service is very elegant , Cambiridge is great place to dine, but I think way to stuffy to stay there.
reviews.title: A little overrated.

likes.liked: — The staff was pleasant and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the Pompano. Just recently came back from Bermuda(July 24-30). Tom and Larry do a great job making you feel welcomed. It's true that some of the furniture of the room could use some updating. Had trouble keeping my dresser drawers closed, but the room was very clean. Great food, five course gourmet meal all the way through. Take the meal plan. You won't eat so much food anywhere else in Bermuda for the money you pay at Pompano. Bermudians are the friendliest people I know. My family and I got a ride to our hotel entrance after a local lady saw us walking from the bus stop. The beach is small but very nice. You will find that not evey guests is going to stay at the beach everyday. Too many things to see and do in Bermuda, including visiting other beaches. Can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Love it , make you feel at home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, we'd like to thank fellow Tripadvisor members for their rave reviews of the Pompano Beach staff and property. We've been to Bermuda three years in a row; first by cruise, then to a very large resort, and this past July to Pompano Beach. We love Bermuda every time we visit, but this time was the BEST because of the staff, management, ownership, and facilities at Pompano. In all our travels, we've never stayed anywhere this warm and welcoming.
reviews.title: Seeing IS Believing!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our positive experiences started even before we left home. They began with email correspondence with Larry, Tom, and Tim, who always responded quickly and positively to our inquiries, and offered any and all assistance before we even arrived. Upon our arrival, Tim, the manager, personally greeted and welcomed us at the shuttle and gave us an extremely helpful tour of the property. We were astounded by the sheer natural beauty of this cliff and oceanside property and the clever layout of the buildings. Tim then personally escorted us to our room - where our bags were already delivered.
reviews.title: A great resort for relaxing, with terrific staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed on the second floor of Porpoise Perch where we had a glorious view of the ocean, pool, and adjacent golf course from our patio. The room was very clean, spacious, and comfortable. The meal plan provided a full breakfast every day, as well as flexible dinner options including the dine-around plan. The free shuttle service to the ferry, market, bus stop, etc., was efficient and readily available at a moment's notice. There's a wide variety of water excursions available prearranged with tour operators. We enjoyed the early evening A. J. Wings sailboat cruise with Captain Anthony and loved the Coral Reefer glass bottom boat with Captain Tony.
reviews.title: It is a paradise and a little bit of heaven! Great resort and excellent service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was always cheerful, helpful, readily available, accessible, accommodating, and did everything in their power to meet our needs. We were amazed at how hands-on and visible Larry and Tom, the owners, were on a daily basis.
reviews.title: No Place like Pompano Beach Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a real sense of community when we first arrived that began with the drive from the main road to the resort. It's secluded enough to offer quiet tranquility, but not too remote from the rest of the island. We planned our trip so that the first night coincided with the rum swizzle party. Wow, what a welcoming party that was. Larry, his daughter, and the staff greeted each guest as they arrived and were on hand to provide unlimited rum sizzles or any other requested drinks and an abundance of the most delicious and interesting variety of hors d'oerves that would be the envy of any wedding or special event. A delicious and bountiful all-you-can-eat barbecue followed where you could either eat in the Cedar Room or their adjoining outside patio. That night and any other night, guests could opt to dine in the Ocean Terrace.
reviews.title: Best Stay in Bermuda

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Pompano Beach Club the first week of September 2009 and enjoyed it very much. This was our first time staying at this resort. We have visited Bermuda many times and are very pleased that we finally booked this hotel. We flew in with Air Canada and had no issues. We booked CEO Transport to/from the resort and were not disappointed, a link can be found on the Pompano website.
reviews.title: Pompano Perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very big and clean as was the bathroom, the shower was huge and there was a double sink. The room was a bit dated in terms of styling but wasn’t a big deal. The view from our windows and balcony were spectacular. We booked the meal plan package (breakfast & dinner) and were pleased that we did. There was always a great variety of food to choose from. We also chose to take advantage of the dining exchange program with The Reefs and Cambridge Beaches. Just ask the front desk to make the reservation for you. We used our moped to get us to each of these locations; otherwise arrangements can be made through the front desk for a taxi.
reviews.title: Nicest getaway we've ever experienced
Beautiful Location for a relaxing casual holiday
reviews.text: The Pompano Beach Club is very quiet and relaxing. Although we did not spend a lot of time using their beach we did enjoy the time that we spent at it. I was amazed that at low tide you can walk out in waist deep water at least 500 yards to a floating dock. It was strange to see so many people walking around that far from shore. Many locals also pull up to this location in their boats and jump into the warm shallow water.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The front desk will make arrangements to drive guests down to Middle Road as it is a bit of a hike. There is also a phone at Pompano Road to call the front desk to pick you up and return you to the hotel. They will also drive you to Oleander Cycles to rent a moped.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Vacation in Bermuda

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: During our stay we rented a small boat from Windjammer Sports at Mangrove Bay for a few hours and toured around. We dropped anchor in several spots and snorkelled. This was a nice way to see different parts of the island. We also rented sea doo’s from Sea Venture Water Sports near the Waterlot Inn. It was enjoyable but I would recommend renting a boat. Make sure to take some bread to feed the fish near the Vixen ship wreck which is located off of Daniels’s Head in Somerset.
reviews.title: Pros and cons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Pompano Beach Club on our honeymoon five years ago and then we went again this year for our fifth wedding anniversary. We were surprised to find that we loved it even more this time than on our honeymoon. They had just finished many renovations including a beautiful new (additional) dining room, more spa rooms (all of which have floor to ceiling windows with gorgeous ocean views), and upgrades to the guestrooms. We had a "Superior" room which turned out to have a minor issue with low water pressure in the shower, so we were promptly upgraded to a "Deluxe" room with a balcony overlooking the ocean. That action impressed us very much.
reviews.title: Loved Pompano even more the second time
View is tremendous, but not kid friendly
reviews.text: We can't say enough good things about the owner, Larry Lamb, and his staff. If his father's saying is true that "a fish stinks from its head" then Pompano is nothing but beautifully fragrant, thanks to Larry's management style, and his willingness to do everything that he expects his staff to do, from hospitably driving a shuttle full of guests to the ferry, to pouring rum swizzle cocktails at their weekly complimentary happy hour, to demonstrating great patience and kindness in helping an indecisive guest who was shopping at the Pompano "mall".

reviews.title: Great Stay at the Pompano
reviews.text: We look forward to our next stay at Pompano. Though we investigated and have considered staying at other places in Bermuda, we doubt we ever will stay anywhere but Pompano due to the great people who work there as well as the beauty of the setting and the lovely, first rate resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Susan and Jim LaRocca
reviews.title: Beautiful, but too casual
25th anniversary honeymoon
reviews.text: Vienna, Virginia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a glorious week at the Pompano Beach Club. We made our decision to stay at Pompano based on the reviews from Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. The Lamb family runs a beautiful resort with some of the friendliest staff we have encountered in our travels. We have stayed at many 5 star locations, including several Four Season resorts, and, though some of the amenities at the Pompano may not be as luxurious as a 5 star, it is made up for in the service, the most beautiful location, a beach with water that in low tide you can walk out 1/2 mile from the beach and still have water up to your waste and an atmosphere of warmth and relaxation. The food is good and the choices at dinner were plentiful. There are 2 excellent restaurants to choose from, however, be sure to make reservations for the Ocean Grille early in the day as it books up quickly. The pastry chef is amazing and the barbecue on Monday evenings is wonderful.
reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation

likes.liked: — size of room, location of room, bathroom
likes.disliked: — towels, amenities in room, maid service at the room could have been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: We enjoy not having to get dressed up at dinner and Pompano is not a formal hotel. So if you are looking for a truly casual, friendly atmosphere, this is the definitely the place to go. We will definitely go back to Pompano.
reviews.title: Good time - VERY kid friendly
A Place with the it Factor
reviews.text: My husband, 5 year old son and I spent 5 nights at the Pompano at the beginning of June. It was our second trip to Pompano and our third to Bermuda- we last went when our son was 3. This is a beautiful resort. I find it very disturbing that people who go without children write reviews saying the place is not suitable for children. Our son loves Pompano which was the reason for our return. They have a special children's menu and he always loves his icecream sundae with chocolate fudge after dinner. The staff make a big fuss of all the kids, saying hi to them by name whenever they see them on the resort, chatting with them etc. All of the this is done in a fun unpretentious way which of course is great for kids. This is one of the very few places you can go with a young child and have a relaxing fairly sophisticated vacation. We were able to go to their beautiful restuarant every night and have a great meal with good wine while our son was served the sort of holiday food he loves. While there were lots of young children there when we were there, all were well behaved, not bothering anyone else and seemed to be having a good time. There also appeared to be a lot of family reunioun vacations where people were flying in from different places around the world. Our son loved the forts, taking a ride in a glass bottomed boat to see the fish on the reefs, the zoo with its giant turtles, crystal caves and most of all the beach and the pool. Anyway, my message is, do not listen to people who do not bring their kids, we always bring our kid and we all have a good time.

reviews.title: Pompano is perfect!
reviews.text: They just get "it" and get "it" right! The Lambs run a top notch hotel, with top notch staff and facilities. Having stayed at many hotels on Bermuda, we are done experimenting and were happy to book a return trip for next year. Our room was great. We had room 44 (the most out of the way suite) and loved the seclusion of our location. Even though it was a walk up some stairs to get to, it was worth the view and just want we needed after the wonderful meals and drinks. The staff could not do enough to cater to our every whim and their friendly demeanor seemed contagious with the other guests. We were traveling alone but somehow we felt as if we had many friends around since everyone seemed so open to engage in pleasant conversations. If you have the chance to try a massage we highly reccomend it. The services at the spa were better than we have had at any other vacation spot. The setting was spectacular and I will dream of floating in the glorious water until I return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: We just returned from a 5 day stay to celebrate our 40th anniversary, and it was perfect! The food was 5-star every night, and breakfasts were plentiful and luscious. Our room and its settiing, right above the beach, was everything we could hope for - 2 window walls on the ocean, bath w/ 2 person shower and a soaking tub, big balcony with both chairs and chaises longues - just lovely (it was in their deluxe category and worth every penny). We did get a transfer one of our 5 nights to the Reefs restaurant and found it not nearly as good as the Pompano's food. Other guests echoed the same sentiment. The menus at the Pompano were different every night. All seating has ocean views and there are 2 different restaurants for eveing meals, with inside or outside dining, sunsets included! A note - it was explained that the Pompano can only transfer guests to other restaurants the number who request a tranfer in. They get to do 2 transfers "free" each night and try not to let the same couples always have the transfers. The men at the front desk and Kerry are especially helpful - they gave great advice on walks , etc. and were always willing to take us to starting points or pick us up. We loved the lack of waves and the freedom to relax on the floats in the calm sea. Try the lemon-grass stress relief massage at the spa - heavenly!
reviews.title: Just OK.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I want to thank all of the people who stayed at the Pompano Beach Club and sent in their reviews. Because of this we had a wonderful week from August 8th to the 15th at the Resort. There can't possibly be a friendlier, more helpful staff from the "hands on" owners Larry and Tom to the servers in the restaurants and the staff on the beach. The location is excellent, the water is crystal clear and calm and if you have children I don't think there could be a safer beach. We would like to give a special thanks to the Interns from the Univeristy of New Hampshire and the University of Massachusettes - what a lovely group of young people eager to help and make your stay enjoyable. This was our fourth trip to Bermuda and I must say the most pleasant. Before we even left to come home we had already decided that Pompano is where we will stay on our next trip to Bermuda.
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort - Beautiful Location
Paradise - Once Again!
reviews.text: This is our third time to the resort. We can not say enough. Yes, you can find less expensive, but the service can not be found elsewhere. From the moment you arrive until you leave, it is as though you are their only patron. You actually become friends with the owners and staff. Their friendly nature, caring ways and helfpulness are truly unmatched by any other hotel we have ever stayed at. Then, couple the service with the location, the drinks, the food - what can I say other than "paradise". If you are looking for a place that is commercialized and always something going on where you may have missed an activity, this is not the place. If you have a busy lifestyle, expect and deserve unsurpassed service, enjoy the peacefulness and serenity of gorgeous sunsets and have a passion for trying new foods, which by the way is the BEST food I have ever tasted, then without hesitation, contact the Pompano. There is nothing these people need to do any better on. They excell in all areas. Love, love, love the Pompano.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i just returned from a week's vacation at the Pompano. The accomodations in their newer ocean front buildings, Angel Fish and Flying Fish, were excellent, (we stayed in suite 84), but our original room #18, although clean, needed some renovation. Due to rain leaking into our room, we were moved to suite 84. All of the staff and owners were extremely friendly and helpful. The food was excellent. Their Monday night BBQ buffet diner was out of this world. We higly recommend this resort and would definitely go back again. (Because their buildings are situated at a high elevation from the beach, you have to walk down about 70 steps to reach the beach. I would not recommend this property if you have any type of leg problems or are very very old.) There were also many families with their children, who all seemed to enjoy themselves.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: D. Todd
reviews.title: poor lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Went for lunch today but did not even order a main course as service was so slow it took 20 minutes after finishing our starter to get the attention of wait staff...by this time just wanted to leave. Great views and friendly staff but a bit slow unless you have all day.
reviews.title: Perfection in Paradise

description: This 75 room beachfront resort has been owned and operated by the Lamb family since 1956. It offers extensive recreational facilities, a breathtaking oceanfront setting, gourmet cuisine, spacious oceanview accommodations, a casual, relaxed atmosphere and personalized, caring service, with Bermudian hospitality that is second to none. The resort overlooks Bermuda's southwest coast and attracts lots of honeymooners, families and couples (especially golfers, watersports enthusiasts and those looking for R&R). Come see why so many of their guests return year after year! The owner-managers are hands-on and passionate about the service they give their guests.
